title: Ticket #5866: Turn on -std=c++0x for g++'s that don't have -std=c++11
description: Sadly, the g++ 4.4 compiler which we use on RHEL6, and will need to support for a while, doesn't fully implement the C++11 spec, as it pre-dates the approval of said spec. However, it does have partial support for c++11, with the -std=c++0x flag. We should turn this flag on for g++ compilers that don't have -std=c++11, so we can enable features like std::unique_ptr.
